dmca.title: Herald-Argus has many eyes for infringement claims
dmca.body:
Dear [Private]:

Our firm represents The Herald-Argus in La Porte, Indiana. It has come to our clients attention that your website has published, without permission, materials, including text and photographs, taken from the editions of The Herald-Argus. These materials are protected by federal copyright.

This constitutes formal notice that such reproduction is unauthorized and in violation of the federal copyright laws. Pursuant to Title 15 of the United States Code, 15 U.S.C. Sec. 504, in a civil action for infringement, The Herald-Argus is entitled at its election to recover actual damages or statutory damages, as determined by the federal court, ranging from $500 to $20,000. In addition, if the federal court determines that the infringement was willful, the court may increase the award up to $100,000. The Herald-Argus intends to vigorously protect its copyrighted materials and any further unauthorized publication of photographs belonging to The Herald-Argus will subject you to a claim for injunctive relief and damages. 

Please conduct yourself accordingly.

Sincerely,

{Signature}

[Private]
